name: Cedarhouse Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first self contained unit, ( all others B & B's ) It was a lovely surprise, I could see us stay here for longer in future say 1 week as we liked the Warkworth area.It is very well appointed and cant think of anything it needs. Even the use of a Laptop for your personal use,so good to check up on our flights.As previous reviewer have said, above the big garage so no noise, the main road is approx 100m away.You get a remote to open the garage door (Classy ) for your car. Lovely Large Garden
reviews.title: Superb self contained Unit
Perfect
reviews.text: If you need to talk to Rosalind, you ring the Cowbell in the main hall. Your breakfast food is left in the kitchen each day inside your unit.Rosalind and Ian are very nice and give you good advice on places to visit and eat. Rosalind give us 1st class instruction to go to the Airport, brilliant, we got there in 1. 1/4 hours via the toll.without speeding. Thank you Rosalind.

My husband & I brought our son from the US to go to university in Auckland. We snuck off for a couple days to Matakana. Cedarhouse was the perfect escape. Rosalind was so kind, she did our laundry, made us cookies, gave us directions & answered all our questions. Her husband even let us use their fax machine. The amenities were also great. It was like staying in our own little apartment. I would highly recommend Cedarhouse!!
reviews.title: lovely & excellent!

reviews.text: and everything had been prepared for our little one (14 months) as well: cot, high chair and a whole box of toys - just to give you an example for all the hospitality there.
reviews.title: Yet another great stay

reviews.text: we stayed there after our flight from europe so we truely enjoyed the beautiful landscape and all the little animals (dog, chickens, kunekune pigs, sheep ...) helped us to stay awake. and we returned on our way back south.
reviews.title: Just Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went for our 2nd visit to Cedarhouse.Unfortunately not a long a stay as we wanted due to family bereavement. Glad we got in at least 2 nights,as we said previously an excellent self contained unit. It has everything you need to have a nice time Plus Rosalind is on hand to give you every assistance. There are many places to visit in the area as well as Warkworth. We had a nice day out visiting Highfield Garden Reserve, (near Algies Bay ) Scandrett region Park nearby.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best place we found was Tawharanui Regional Park,reall nice for a day out especially Anchor Bay. (now our favorite.)
reviews.title: fantastic haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank You Rosalind for letting us stay again during your troubled time
reviews.title: Wonderful space.

description: Cedarhouse Bed and Breakfast sits on 7 acres of native bush, gardens, wetlands and pastureland just 3km east of Warkworth Village in Matakana’s "Magic Mile," overlooking the Ascension Vineyard and Matakana Valley. We offer spacious studio loft accommodation with a queen sized bed, en-suite bathroom, cosy sitting and dining area, balcony with table and chairs, Sky TV, DVD, kitchenette with fridge and microwave.
